meanings.definition: Sarangis (noun): A type of stringed musical instrument originating from India.
meanings.sent1: The musician played a beautiful sarangis at the concert.
meanings.sent2: I heard the soothing sound of the sarangis in the background.
meanings.sent3: The sarangis seemed to whisper ancient melodies to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the sarangis strings like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The sarangis echoed through the hall, filling it with enchanting music.

meanings.definition: Sarangis (verb): To play a sarangi instrument.
meanings.sent1: She sarangis with passion and skill during the performance.
meanings.sent2: I want to learn how to sarangis like a professional.
meanings.sent3: He sarangis every evening to relax after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The musician sarangis the sarangi as if it were an extension of himself.
meanings.sent5: They sarangis together, creating harmonious melodies that touched the soul.

meanings.definition: Sarangis (adjective): Describing something related to or characteristic of a sarangi instrument.
meanings.sent1: The sarangis music filled the room with a sense of tranquility.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate sarangis design on the instrument.
meanings.sent3: The sarangis craftsmanship was evident in every detail of the instrument.
meanings.sent4: His performance had a sarangis quality that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sarangis melodies transported the listeners to a different world.
